data.title: Add 'Copy Node Path' action to right mouse menu
data.body: This should make external text editor happy :P

data.title: RPC referencing level objects with different instances ID's on different machines
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**

windows 10 and ubuntu, godot version 2.2

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):

I'm trying to get multiplayer working using the high level networking in 2.2.

I am passing an object to an RPC function. On the client that calls the RPC function, the RPC function gets called and has a valid pointer to the objects. On the other client, I get null pointers.

I have debugged the instance_id for these objects and noticed they are different on the two clients. I assume this instance id is meant to be the same on both clients in order for a correct reference to be obtained. These objects I am referencing are just objects in the level.

I've printed out the instances id's of all game objects to debug this and notice that there is an issue as soon as my level has loaded.

if you diff these two files:
[log.txt](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/706509/log.txt)
[log_nix.txt](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/706510/log_nix.txt)

on file is the client (log_nix.txt) the other is the server log (log.txt)

you will see the id's go out of sync at:

Linux: World - ID: 950
Windows: World - ID: 952

I suspect this is the problem.

If a client does not connect, my windows machine ID is around 948, so when the client connects this is when the id's are going out of sync. I suspect the server makes some game objects that are discarded at this point.
Even if this is the case, a typical game might make different objects throwing instance id's out of sync even before the client connects.

There looks like there needs to be a special synchronization of instance id's.







**Steps to reproduce:**


**Link to minimal example project** (optional but very welcome):

data.title: .gitignore: Added VC++ cache database and temporary storage folder when debugging
data.body:
I added a cache file and directory steadily occuring for me when using VS2015:

- `*.VC.opendb`: Gets created when the solution is opened and has the format `$(SolutionName).VC.opendb`. Will be automatically deleted when the solution is closed. There's already a `*.VC.VC.opendb` entry, but I think that one is a typo and might be deleted.
- `enc_temp_folder`: This directory stores changes done while debugging which are then copied back to the original files when the debug session ended.

data.title: Fix error while JSON::parse with empty string
data.body: Stop crash when parse json from empty string

data.title: Replace the existing PRNG (Xorshift31) with (minimal) PCG-32.
data.body: PCG is better than many alternatives by most metrics (see www.pcg-random.org) including statistical quality.

data.title: Create demo project and ensure completion of accelerometer/gyro/magnetometer on both iOS and Android
data.body:
This is more a reminder then an issue, Akien asked me to raise this so we don't forget to do this.

PR #7127 has now been merged into the Godot master to enable this functionality on iOS. This worked fine for Godot 2 but we're waiting on completion of changes to the new renderer engine before this can be properly tested in Godot 3.

On Android #7503 needs to be finished to ensure compatibility between the two platforms. I unfortunately do not have access to Android.

Last but not least, it would be good to create one or two demo projects both to include in the Godot demos and to test this functionality to ensure it works consistently.

I do have an early prototype using this functionality to control the camera for a little Cardboard VR game but there are a few other simple concepts that would be good to demo such as maybe a compass or the basis or an AR type game (I hope to look into capturing camera input soon).

data.title: A repeating Timer accumulates a precision error over time.
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Windows 10 64bit - Godot 2.2 alpha

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
A repeating Timer will take longer than expected to execute x number of times. For example a timer with a wait time of 0.125 should run 80 times in 10 seconds, but for me it takes about 10.5 seconds. And 480 times should take 60 seconds, however it takes about 64 seconds. This happens with both idle and fixed time.

**Link to minimal example project** (optional but very welcome):
A script to illustrate this:
```GDScript
extends Timer

var start_time
var end_time

var count = 0
var count_max = 80

func _ready():
	connect("timeout", self, "_on_timeout")
	set_wait_time(0.125)
	set_one_shot(false)
	set_timer_process_mode(TIMER_PROCESS_FIXED)
	start()
	start_time = OS.get_ticks_msec()

func _on_timeout():
	count += 1
	if count >= count_max:
		stop()
		end_time = OS.get_ticks_msec()
		print("time to complete: ", end_time - start_time)
```

data.title: Dragging between scenes causes a crash.
data.body:
My system information: http://pasted.co/ca4970b9

Reproducible in 2.1.1.stable.official and also on 2.2 (built from latest GitHub source of that branch)

Trying to drag a node from one scene to another causes the editor to crash
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2046959/21957992/88258f20-da8a-11e6-8137-33b940e90cd2.png)

To reproduce, start by dragging a node and then Ctrl+Tab into another scene. As soon as you try to add the node to the new scene, it will crash (see below)
![giphy](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2046959/21958011/f6d1f4b8-da8a-11e6-8522-f8b35aaba891.gif)

Thank you for your time!

data.title: Add menu item in the inspector to show file in FileSystem
data.body:
Fixes https://github.com/godotengine/godot/issues/7449

- Added a method to navigate and display a given directory or file.
- To programmatically show the file view in non-split mode (dunno why the boolean variable is named `split_mode` when it's true when it's _not_ in a splitted view) I used `_open_pressed()` as it was the only method capable of doing so. Maybe needs some refactoring to switch to file view only.

data.title: Fix _Directory::get_current_drive error condition from breaking the build
data.body: `_Directory::get_current_drive` returns an `int`, so `ERR_FAIL_COND_V(!d,"")` broke the build by returning a `String` instead.

data.title: String: plus_file(String) no longer adds a root
data.body:
`String::plus_file(String)` is a helper method to join paths. It's similar to Python's `os.path.join`. However, unlike the latter, `plus_file` can add a root to the path if the first string is empty, e.g:

``` GDScript
# Python
os.path.join("", "file") # Returns "file"
# GDScript
"".plus_file("file") # Returns "/file"
```

This shouldn't be the correct behaviour. It forces you to add lot of `if str.empty()` conditions to avoid bugs when working with relative paths.

This PR fixes that. Now the user has to explicitly specify if he wants an absolute path:

``` GDScript
# Python
os.path.join("", "file") # Returns "file"
os.path.join(os.sep, "file") # Returns "/file"
# GDScript
"".plus_file("file") # Returns "file"
"/".plus_file("file") # Returns "/file"
```

Also this PR fixes possible duplicated separators:

``` GDScript
"whatever".plus_file("/usr").plus_file("bin")
# Before
"whatever//usr/bin"
# After
"whatever/usr/bin"
```

There is still a difference with `os.path.join` here though:

``` GDScript
os.path.join("whatever", "/usr", "bin") # Returns "/usr/bin"
"whatever".plus_file("/usr").plus_file("bin") # Returns "whatever/usr/bin"
```

But I don't really agree with `os.path.join` here anyway and we don't have to use exactly the same, so...

WDYT?

data.title: The "-lod:dist" import flag does not work.
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Godot v2.1.1.stable.official
Ubuntu Gnome 16.04 - x86_64
NVIDIA GeForce GTX570 - Driver version: 367.57

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):

The "-lod" import flag does not work.
When importing a .DAE file containing objects with -lod<somedistance> in their names, Godot is supposed to automatically set Range begin to whatever number is at "-lodxxx", and according to the importer code, it is also supposed to set Range end to 100000.
It currently does not do any of these things, for as far as I can see.
[Link to Q&A post](https://godotengine.org/qa/11606/how-use-the-lod-dist-import-flag-in-the-import-3d-scene-window)

**Steps to reproduce:**
1. Create a scene in blender and include objects named like this: some_mesh-lod10 etc.
2. Export the scene with the Better Collada Exporter, and import to Godot 2.1.1.
3. Open the imported scene in the Godot editor and check the Range begin and Range end properties.

data.title: 2.1.x Cherry pick patch to enable 2D split screen. ( #6486 )
data.body:
Cherry picked the two commits to easily allow 2d split screen via GDScript ( #6486 ).
I'm also preparing a PR on the demo repository to backport the "Split Screen 2D Platformer" to 2.1 API.

data.title: Make time_scale behave similarly to pause
data.body: time_scale is really useful for slo-mo in games, but making it global limits use cases severely. What I propose is to handle changing scale similar to pause, where user can select some nodes/branches to be excluded from slo mo goodness.

data.title: Pop_front() and Pop_back do not return anything
data.body:
This feels weird enough I thought I would bring it up.
pop_front() and pop_back() just modify the array they are called from.
They do not return anything, which seems counterproductive.
they are already oneliners at present, array.remove(0) and array.remove(array.size()) respectively.
When I think their intended use was

pop_front ():
var temp = array[0]
array.remove(0)
return(temp)

and

pop_back():
var temp = array[array.size]
array.resize(array.size-1)
return(temp)

Correct me if this is the correct behaviour, but this feels weird.

data.title: Improve Web export presentation
data.body:
Web export still fails to run with ES3, but now looks nice while doing so

Give it a try (in 2.2-alpha): http://godot.eska.me/temp/web-presentation/

 - Check for WebGL support, don't load if unsupported, fixes #3570
 - Check for IndexedDB support, fixes #2758
 - Make canvas failure message visible
 - Colored debug output for warnings and errors
 - Make it obvious status can be closed by clicking
 - Don't use status to display non-critical errors
 - Limit output message count
 - Add output clear button
 - Fix setting total memory
 - Some style changes

Also add 'Droid Sans' as default font. I'm not including it as a web font though, I don't want to contact a CDN by default. Users can manually link it in the export options (style or head include)

Some build system tuning:
 - Emscripten injects its loader script when linking, so force relinking whenever the HTML shell changes
 - Remove useless FULL_ES2 flag, which should've been a linker flag, but would impact performance too much

data.title: Visibility toggle should hide locks from 2D editor
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
All Godot versions.

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
When hiding of a node (CanvasItem) with a lock, the node is hidden but the lock remains visible affecting the usability of the visibility toggle in the editor.

![lockvisibility](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/10215987/21946081/94a4edc2-d9bd-11e6-8c07-f29288de7732.png)


That feature on the 2D editor is good to get a less convoluted environment and view or edit details, and hiding the locks too would help a lot (are useless on hidden nodes anyway),

**Steps to reproduce:**
Create one or many Node2D or Control on a scene, put any lock on it (for the node or children), toggle visibility from the scene tree or inspector, the node will be hidden but the lock will remain visible.

data.title: Add feature to disable tabs in TabContainer and Tabs control.
data.body:
`Tabs` and `TabContainer` control can now get their tabs disabled or enabled. Fixes #7436.

- If the currently active tab is disabled, it stays visible, but after a change to another tab it cannot be selected anymore.
- The close button on disabled tabs cannot be clicked.
- Visual design of a disabled tab is the one of a disabled button.

data.title: API refactorings for 3.0 -- continued
data.body:
List of things that were forgotten / overlooked in #5696 and #6523, and should either be changed or disagreed with:

## Confusing names

- [x] Input.get_mouse_speed() returns the speed of the last non-null mouse motion, not the current one. It could be renamed to Input.get_last_mouse_speed() or similar.
- [x] Tween.set_speed() is confusing as it returns a scale, could be renamed to set_speed_scale() (#2060) Same with the property (#6935).
- [x] OS.get_ticks_msec() => should be named get_time_msec(), the name makes it hard to find it (it was for me) because no one would search for tick to get the current ms-precise time. (@Zylann)
- [x] Why File.get/store_***(content) instead of File.read/write_***(content) as any other I/O API? (@Zylann)
- [x] Vector2::get_aspect should probably become Vector2::aspect, since none of the other methods in the class have the get_ prefix. (@bojidar-bg)
- [x] set_send_address should be set_destination_address. When I first saw this function I thought I will be able to set packet origin IP/Port (so I can later listen on that port - I'm trying to do UDP hole punching). Sadly it's something different. (@Marqin)
- [x] rotation setters and getters must be standarized:, currently there are many variations like: set_rot, set_rotation, set_rotation_deg, set_rotationd, set_rotd (@djrm)
- [x] In String we have `get_base_dir()` `get_file()`. Why not the same with `basename() -> get_basename()` `extension() -> get_extension()` (@AlexHolly)
- [x] set_enable_monitoring( bool enable ) to set_monitoring( bool enable ) (@jtaart)
- [x] Rename `rang_range` to `randi_range` and add `randf_range`, to match `randi` and `randf` (#6235)

## Functions to change

- [x] DirAccess::list_dir_begin should return Error like other functions of this kind.
- [x] SceneTree.call_group() (and notify_group()) requires flags as the first argument, which pretty much just results in many zeros in the code, I'd suggest an alternative call_group_flags() or something to mitigate this, and remove the flags argument from call_group(). (@WalasPrime)

## Functions to remove

- [x] OS.set_video_mode() (https://github.com/godotengine/godot/issues/3778#issuecomment-233447010).
- [x] OS.get_fullscreen_mode_list() (https://github.com/godotengine/godot/pull/4624#issuecomment-218515473).

## Properties to remove

- [x] Expand from TextureFrame. The Strech Mode property is much more flexible and can do some things that already override the Expand settings.

## Bug

- [x] Many nodes override inherited methods, which makes the said methods uncallable from GDScript.
Here is a small list: Viewport::get_viewport, CanvasItem::get_viewport, EditorPlugin::get_name (@bojidar-bg)

## Refactoring

- [x] Add proper support for static methods like `File.file_exists()` instead of `File.new().file_exists()`

## Things to move

#### Constants in global scope that could be namespaced

Some constants have redundant naming, for example in VisibilityEnabler2D, all identifiers have the ENABLER_ prefix, but it seem useless since they already are scoped in the class.
On the opposite side, there are a lot of consts that are outside of any class, and it can be confusing. For example, the first time I looked for button codes I was trying to get them from Input, or InputEvent, to no avail. So I eventually used the raw numbers, to finally find they are in global scope like KEY_A or BUTTON_LEFT. (@Zylann)

data.title: Use Animation's Name as Filename When Saving
data.body: Fix for Issue #7433. When saving Animations we check to see if the Animation has a name, if so we use that as the filename; otherwise we default to the previous string ("new_" + resource name).

CanvasItem's Pivot Point Won't Change
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Ubuntu MATE, Godot 2.1.1

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
In trying to change a CanvasItem's pivot point, clicking it in the editor and then pressing and holding V, it doesn't work. Instead it moves the CanvasItem to the location of the mouse pointer. The inspector records the offset change, though. But as I said, in the editor the CanvasItem just moves to the mouse cursor, instead of the pivot point actually moving.

**Steps to reproduce:**
Try to change a CanvasItem's pivot point.

**Link to minimal example project** (optional but very welcome):

data.title: Particle z-order changes during lifetime for Particles2D
data.body:
**Windows 10 - Godot version: v2.1.1.stable.official**

**Issue description**:
When emitting particles, the z-order changes during lifetime creating an unintended effect where 2D particles sudden jump in front of eachother

**Steps to reproduce:**
* Create an empty scene with a root node and Particles2D node

* Custom Texture (NB! make large to see that it actually changes the draw order)
* Config (other than default):
  * Amount=3
  * Lifetime=3
  * Explosiveness=0

* Params (other than default):
  * Direction=180
  * Spread=45
  * Linear Velocity=100
  * Gravity Direction=180
  * Gravity Strength=10
  * Damping=180

**Link to GIF animation**:
[Dropbox shared animation](https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/541553/Misc/godot-particle-bug.gif)

data.title: TCP connect always opens the correct socket type
data.body: TCP client connections does not need to rely on ipv6 dual stack sockets

data.title: Project setting to control node name casing
data.body: As discussed in https://github.com/godotengine/godot/pull/7501, I modified my changes to make this a project setting.

data.title: Fix two problems with Area2D and remove_child()
data.body:
- When one of two or more overlapping Area2Ds is removed with remove_child(), it doesn't try to report to the other one anymore
- When overlappinng Area2Ds are removed woth remove_child(), _enter_tree and _exit_tree signals are now properly disconnected upon removal

Fixes #7507.
Since the master branch doesn't compile for me at the moment without reverting some earlier commits and due to the many bugs it has right now, testing it is a bit difficult (but it works fine on 2.2). It should be fine though since the changes are minimal.

Also removed some unnessecary empty lines from the file.

data.title: Removing overlapping Area2Ds with remove_child() causes errors
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Arch linux 64 - 2.2 branch

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
1. When you have an Area2D and another Area2D or a PhysicsBody overlapping and set that they report collisions to each other, and you remove the Area2D from the tree (with `remove_child()`), you get errors like 

> ERROR: _body_inout: Condition ' !body_in && !E ' is true ...
or
> ERROR: _body_inout: Condition ' !area_in && !E ' is true ...

`call_deferred("remove_child", child)` does NOT work here. It seems that they try to report another collider leaving the area although they are already removed from the scene. 
The only ways for me to fix that were to use `set_monitoring_enabled()` in `_enter_tree` and `_exit_tree` or set them to different layers/masks (which is not a solution, they have to collide for gameplay reasons).
I already made a fix for that, using the monitoring solution from above (which I will make a pull request for as soon as the second problem is solved).

2. When having multiple overlapping  Area2Ds (and optionally PhysicsBodies) as children of one parent node in the scene, removing this parent node from the scene with `remove_child()` without freeing it and readding it after that will cause errors:

> Condition ' !E ' is true
and in some cases also 

> Signal enter/exit_tree already connected to given method _area_enter_tree in that object.

All of those are thrown in area_2d.cpp when re-adding the Area2ds to the scene. So for some reason the connections aren't removed when removing the parent node is removed. But I'm still trying to figure out what causes the first error. And what is even weirder, if you make the Area2D's not overlap anymore after the errors have been thrown and you redo the whole thing, more errors are thrown although they should not be reporting collisiosn to each other anymore. 
`call_deferred()` doesn't work here either.

I'm trying to fix this right now, if anyone has any hints regarding that, that would be helpful.
None of those problems occur if you just `queue_free() ` them and reinstance them, but I like to keep my player object and my levels (that are just instanced children of a parent world node whichs has the UI and stuff) instanced when switching them, so they are in the same state as before when they get reloaded into the world. 

**Steps to reproduce:**
1. bug: Make two or more Area2Ds, let them overlap. Remove one of them using remove_child()
2. bug: Make two or more Area2Ds as children of a parent node, let them overlap. Remove and re-add the parent node with a script (this will likely also cause the 1. bug)
